title: Pamphlet, Push Pin Graphic Number 57 / Master & Dog, 1972
title_raw: Push Pin Graphic Number 57 / Master & Dog
medium: Offset lithography on heavy off-white wove paper
inscribed: Imprinted across bottoms of last four pages, publication information: Push Pin Studios, Metro Typograhers, Astoria Press, CA Magazine, Sam Flax Inc., and Filmsense, Inc.  Also statement that Stephanie McLuhan and Phyllis Flood represent the designers
description: Eight f. (2 pages); imprinted on front cover, cartoon-like bearded man and dog in vaudevillian poses moving right; man is white bearded and wears green top hat, spats, and white gloves; dog is orange with white and dances on hind feet; four rows of theatre seats spread horizontally across bottom of design suggest a theater interior; imprinted across top of page: Master & Dog; imprinted inside front cover, lower left corner, publication information.  Imprinted on inside pages, essay entitled "Affection's Claim" from "Man Needs Dog" by Konrad Lorenz, 1953; across last four pages, publication information along bottom of pages and starting on third page from end, one long blue dachshund dog facing left extended across three pages, with "Advertisements" imprinted across its torso.  On back cover, black and white cartoon of beggar man and his dog standing on sidewalk, man holds cup and wears sign on chest: "God Bless You."

tombstone.epitaph:
Pamphlet, Push Pin Graphic Number 57 / Master & Dog, 1972. Offset lithography on heavy off-white wove paper. 
Gift of Seymour Chwast. 1998-74-16
